intro: Corybas taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan helmet orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the兰科 (Orchidaceae) family and is characterized by its unique, helmet-like flower structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often on rocky substrates. Its flowers are usually small and have a distinctive, intricate morphology with a spurred lip. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
